speaker: Niles
text: Oh, now look at that couch.  Now this is something you might want to consider for your new office.  Although, I'm not sure how well that, what is that, sort of linen, is going to wear. Oh, you know what I'm going to wear at the opera fund raiser on Friday night?  Or is it Saturday?  I'll check my book.  A lovely linen shirt with my new Zegnia suit.  [_He lays down on the couch._]

speaker: Niles
text: That's a funny word, "Zegnia".  The "g" is silent.  Silent "g" like lasagna.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you notice that you've been awfully chatty lately?

speaker: Niles
text: No, but Daphne mentioned it to me this morning.  [_He gets up._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what about this one?  Frasier, you really must make a decision.  We've been to six stores already, and oh, that reminds me, I must cancel our squash game tomorrow...

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you hear that?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, now that you mention it, I do.  It's sort of like a nervous tic of some kind.  I wonder what could be causing it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's see:  you do have a baby on the way.  Perhaps your incessant jabbering is just a way of distracting yourself from this life changing event.

speaker: Niles
text: How could I have missed something so obvious?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not so hard to believe.  You were fifteen before you discovered there was a correlation between being beaten up every day and going to school in a Panama hat.  [_Niles takes out his handkerchief and dusts off a couch, then sits down.  Frasier stares at a woman across the showroom._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm?

speaker: Frasier
text: Does that woman look familiar to you?

speaker: Niles
text: No, but do you know what does?  This couch.  We're back where we started, will you pick something?

speaker: Frasier
text: My God!  That's Ronee Lawrence.

speaker: Niles
text: Who?  [_Niles gets up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: She used to baby-sit for us.  Oh my God, I had a crush on her.  She's the first girl to ever break my heart.  I used to watch her through the banister, making out with her boyfriend.  Chad.

speaker: Niles
text: Ronee Lawrence!  She's the fiend who told me all those ghastly bed time stories about tiny insects that would crawl into my ears and eat my brains.  Earwigs!  I, I wore a football helmet to bed for a month that year!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know, you really had Dad's hopes up there for a while.  [_Frasier walks over to the woman._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, are you Ronee Lawrence?

speaker: Ronee
text: That's what it says on my driver's... wait a sec.  Frasier? Oh, my God, it is you.  [_They hug._]

speaker: Frasier
text: It's good to see you.  Niles and I were just...

speaker: Ronee
text: Niles!  Oh, my God, little Nervous Niles?  I can't believe it!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, it's all terribly true.

speaker: Frasier
text: You look fantastic.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, well, it's a lot of work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course it is.  You know, exercise, dieting and all...

speaker: Ronee
text: No, I've had a lot of work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Ronee
text: Every time something sags, drags or bags, I get Dr. Goldman right on top of it.  And then I call a plastic surgeon.  [_She nudges Niles and laughs._]

speaker: Niles
text: Funny.  Well, it's nice running into you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, we've got a moment, I think.  So, what have you been up to?

speaker: Ronee
text: I sing and play the piano down at the Wellington Hotel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, great, great.

speaker: Ronee
text: Of course, I know what you do, mister big-time radio shrink.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, actually I'm getting back into private practice as well.  In fact, we're here today picking out a couch for my new offices.  I saw you checking out the Barcaloungers.  Are you buying a chair for your husband?

speaker: Ronee
text: Only if it's wired for electricity.  We're divorced.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, you know, you must come by the house to do a proper catch up.  I know my dad would love to see you again.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, actually, I'm free tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then how about cocktails around seven?  I'm at the Elliot Bay Towers, on the Counterbalance.  [_Niles lays down on another couch._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Great.  It'll be just like old times.  Except you get to stay up late.  Hey, Niles, do you remember when I used to tell you those scary bed time stories?

speaker: Niles
text: No, not really.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, yeah.  You thought there were earwig eggs on all the furniture and you started taking one of those hankies out and wiping off all the chairs before you'd sit in them because you were afraid...  [_She makes crawling and burrowing motions at his head._]

speaker: Niles
text: Nothing still, I'm sorry.

speaker: Ronee
text: I'm glad.  For a while there I was afraid that maybe I scarred you for life.  Bloop!  [_She pokes at his head and he stiffens up._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, I gotta run, I'll see you guys tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, bye.  [_He watches as she hurries off, then turns to Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay go ahead, Niles.  [_Niles twitchily gets up and gets a handkerchief._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, she put her fingers in my ears....

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, I know...

speaker: Niles
text: She was just...

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, give it a good one.  [_Niles rubs his ears with the handkerchief and then furiously wipes down the couch.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Niles and Daphne are on the couch, Frasier is opening a bottle of wine._]

speaker: Daphne
text: So, Frasier, did you find a couch?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I must've tested a hundred for him.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, have some sympathy, Niles.  Obviously, my foot-dragging is a kind of avoidance.  After all, I haven't been in private practice for twelve years.  Maybe I don't have the skills anymore.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't worry.  Your patients will never notice.  [_Niles gets an hors d'oeuvre._]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, if he doesn't pick a couch soon, patients will be lying on the floor.  What is this?  It smells...oh, it's olive topinade!  Your going to an awful lot of trouble for a "Drop by sometime" kind of evening.  Here Daphne, try this, ooh, try one of these.  Ooh, spring rolls.  Oh, we found the best Chinese restaurant today...  [_Daphne slaps him on the arm._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Still got the gift of gab, I see.

speaker: Niles
text: I really don't know why you insisted we be here tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: I just didn't want Ronee to think I was coming on too strong.  I was hoping this reunion might lead to a countdown for a future liftoff from Cape Crane-averal.

speaker: Niles
text: If you tortured that metaphor anymore, you'd be before a tribunal in the Hague.  [_Martin comes in the front door with Eddie._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad.  Hey.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.  Wow, what's with the fancy spread?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles and I ran into Ronee Lawrence today and she's coming over for cocktails.  You remember, our old babysitter.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.  I remember Ronee.  Pretty little thing.  Yeah, how's she looking these days?

speaker: Niles
text: Eyes pulled so tight she could land a roll in "Flower Drum Song".

speaker: Frasier
text: She happens to look fabulous.  [_The doorbell rings and Frasier goes to answer it._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Which you will soon see for yourself.  She's playing the piano down at the Wellington.  [_He opens the door, it is Ronee._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ronee, hi.  Come on in.  Good to see you.  [_She enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Meet my sister-in-law, Daphne.

speaker: Ronee
text: Hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nice to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: And of course, you remember my dad.

speaker: Ronee
text: Of course.  How are you Mr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: It's Marty and I'm just great.  Gee, you haven't changed a bit.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh yes I have.  I can legally drink now.  [_They all laugh._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Hint hint.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh right.   Would you like a glass of wine?

speaker: Ronee
text: Yes.  Thank you.  [_Frasier walks over to the table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, why don't you get yourself a beer?  [_Martin sits back down._]

speaker: Martin
text: So, Ronee, what have you been doing with yourself all these years?

speaker: Ronee
text: Singing, mostly, I play at the Rendezvous Room down at the Wellington Hotel.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is that that place that revolves?

speaker: Ronee
text: It used to.  It broke two years ago.  [_Martin bursts out laughing._]

speaker: Martin
text: That's terrific.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, I had a couple of shots at the big time, you know, sang in some swankier rooms, I even made an album.  Ronee Lawrence:  Mood Swings.  It sold about seven copies and that's when Ronee Lawrence had herself a real mood swing.  [_Frasier hands her a glass of wine._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I'm sure the album was just wonderful.  You know, maybe I can interest you in a duet a little later.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, that'd be fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wouldn't it, though?  I have a feeling that our musical styles just might harmoni...

speaker: Martin
text: So, Ronee, I bet you really wow them at the Rendezvous.

speaker: Ronee
text: You know, it's not exactly Carnegie Hall.  Most of them are half in the bag and just trying not to spill their drinks. And I'm just talking about the cocktail waitresses.  [_Martin laughs loudly again._]

speaker: Martin
text: This girl's a riot!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, could you help me with something in the kitchen?

speaker: Martin
text: Now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right now!  [_They start for the kitchen._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Don't be long, you two.  Mama likes an audience.

speaker: Martin
text: Good.  'Cause Daddy likes to watch.  [_Frasier pulls him the rest of the way into the kitchen.  Cut to - the kitchen as Martin is pulled around._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

speaker: Martin
text: I was working my magic on her.  Why are you so upset?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because I'm working a little magic of my own.  And your magic was mucking up my magic!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I thought you brought her here for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Since WHEN do I bring you women?!  What are you, the Sultan of Brunei?  [_Cut to - the living room.  Ronee's cell phone goes off and she answers as Martin and Frasier come back into the room._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Hello? ... What? ... Oh, you're kidding. ...  Yeah, yeah, okay I guess.  I'll see you in a bit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, I have to go into work.  The guy who fills in on my night off called in sick.  [_She stands up and finishes off her wine._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry.

speaker: Ronee
text: Promise me we'll do this again.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know we will.  You can count on that.

speaker: Martin
text: Try to keep us away.

speaker: Ronee
text: Frasier, you owe me a duet.  It was great to see you, Marty. You should all come down to the club sometime.

speaker: Martin
text: You can count on that too.

speaker: Frasier
text: We'll be there with bells on.  [_He opens the door for Ronee and she leaves._]

speaker: Martin
text: Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye, see you later.  [_Frasier closes the door and glares at Martin._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't believe the way you are humiliating yourself.  A man your age!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, she was flirting with me!

speaker: Frasier
text: She was flirting with me!  You just got caught in the crossfire.

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne, you saw it.  Which one of us was she attracted to?  [_He gets his jacket and puts it on._]

speaker: Daphne
text: How stupid do you think I am?  Does it say "Stupid" on me forehead?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.  If you insist on humiliating yourself, how's this: I will invite Ronee over for dinner this weekend and she can choose for herself.  Agreed?

speaker: Martin
text: Fine.  Make sure she brings a friend so there's someone for you.  [_He opens the door._]

speaker: Martin
text: I'm going to McGinty's.  [_He leaves.  Frasier stares at the door for a moment._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't suppose he's sneaking down to the Rendezvous, do you?

speaker: Niles
text: No.  Only a scoundrel would violate a gentleman's agreement that way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Quite right.  Dad is nothing if not an honorable man.  I don't know what I was thinking.  [_He walks back towards the bedrooms._]

speaker: Niles
text: Can we give you a lift down there?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I want to freshen up first.  See yourselves out.  [_He heads off.  Fade out._]   **HERE COMES ANOTHER MOOD SWING** [_Fade in.  Ronee is playing the piano and singing "My Funny Valentine"._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Don't change a hair for me... [_to a customer_]  _You've only got the two._ Not if you care for me... Stay little valentine, stay... Each day is Valentine's Day.  [_The patrons applaud as she finishes._]

speaker: Ronee
text: I'm going to take a little break.  Try not to kill yourselves with disappointment.  [_She gets up as Frasier walks in.  She hurries over to him._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Hey, Frasier, what a nice surprise.

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess I just didn't want our little reunion ending so abruptly.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, you're not the only one.

speaker: Frasier
text: I had a feeling you might say that.  [_Martin comes up and hands Ronee a drink._]

speaker: Martin
text: Here you go, Ronee.

speaker: Ronee
text: Thanks.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fraizh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, Marty didn't want to call it a night, either.  He's quite the party guy.  [_looking across the room_]  Walter, you're alive!  [_She walks off._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You said you were going to McGinty's.  How long have you been here?

speaker: Martin
text: Forty-five minutes.  You shouldn't have spent so long on your hair, Louise.  [_Ronee comes back._]

speaker: Ronee
text: So boys, who needs a drink?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'll have another beer.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, you really ought to slow down there.   At his age, one slip and it's the ICU and then it's I see you later.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wouldn't worry about me, Fraizh.  I don't feel any older now than I did when you were parading around in your mother's heels.  [_They all laugh._]

speaker: Martin
text: Of course, that was just last Christmas.

speaker: Ronee
text: Listen, I've gotta do another set.  Are you going to stick around?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you bet we are.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure.  Wouldn't miss it.  Ronee got me a ringside table right next to her.

speaker: Ronee
text: And that's because I want you and your pockets right near my tip jar.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you're after my money, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, Ronee, it's such a beautiful piano, it's a shame we didn't get a chance to do our duet.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, let's do it now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, sure.  You don't mind scrunching, do you?  My bench is a little small.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't mind scrunching at all.  [_He smirks at Martin.  Then sits next to Ronee.  She covers the microphone and whispers to Frasier._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Listen, is it just me or am I getting some signals here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it is most definitely not just you.

speaker: Ronee
text: Hi, drinkers, I'm back.  And no, no, you're not seeing double, for once.  I have a guest with me tonight.  Believe it or not, I used to baby-sit this guy.  I know, I know, how does she stay so young?

speaker: Crowd
text: Dr. Goldman!

speaker: Ronee
text: Aren't they adorable?  Please welcome Dr. Frasier Crane.  [_Frasier takes a quick bow as the crowd applauds._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Do you know this one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I love this song.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, me too.  You know, I'd like to sing it to someone special who's here tonight, but I'm afraid it might embarrass him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sure you special someone would just love to hear it.

speaker: Ronee
text: Really?  Okay then, here goes.  [_Frasier begins playing while Ronee sings._]

speaker: Ronee
text: I get no kick from champagne. Mere alcohol doesn't thrill me at all. So tell me then why it should it be true, That I get a kick out of you?  [_She seductively points at Martin and Frasier misses a chord. Embarrassed, he plasters on a smile and keeps playing, banging the keys louder as she goes on.._]

speaker: Ronee
text: I think you're cute, Marty Crane. I think that if your poor hip wasn't stiff You could dance just terrifically, too. And I get a kick out of you.  [_Martin has been grinning.  Frasier pounds the last notes, a furious look on his face.  Fade out._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment_  **HARD CHEESE**  [_Fade in.  Frasier is slouched on the sofa, a plate on his chest, watching TV.  The front door is open. Niles walks in and notices the disarray in the living room._]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?  Do you realize the door's wide open?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  Pizza guy forgot to close it when he left.  What're you doin' here?  [_Niles closes the door behind him._]

speaker: Niles
text: Don't you remember?  We had plans to watch "Don Giovanni" on PBS.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm kinda into "Wheel of Fortune" right now.  [_Martin comes in from his room, dressed up._]

speaker: Niles
text: Wow, you look awfully dapper.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'm meetin' a friend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you don't have to be so coy.  I know where you're goin'.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm havin' dinner with Ronee.

speaker: Niles
text: Ho-ho!  So things are going well?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.  Great, great.  Turns out she had a crush on me back in the days she used to sit for you boys.  [_Frasier sits up and turns off the TV._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I better scoot.  See you boys.

speaker: Niles
text: Bye, Dad.  [_Martin goes out the front door._]

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, are those profiteroles?  [_Frasier quickly snatches up the snacks and stuffs them in his mouth._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, did you want one?

speaker: Niles
text: No, but thanks for offering.  [_sitting_]  Frasier, what's going on with you?  You're showing classic signs of depression.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's because I'm depressed, you nit!

speaker: Niles
text: But why?  Ronee and you aren't compatible.  You have few interests in common, she's as coarse as sandpaper...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I know, I know there was no future for Ronee and me. I'm depressed, Niles.  I don't know why.  Wait a minute...

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait a minute... I think I can make a really great sandwich out of all my leftover chutneys.  [_He gets up and heads to the kitchen, Niles follows.  Cut to - the kitchen as they enter.  Frasier starts pulling jars out of the refrigerator._]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you have got to snap out of this.  You start seeing patients soon.  You realize you're only using food to fill a void.  Oh, I forgot to void that check to the dry cleaner. I got my camel coat home, it had a spot the size of a krugerrand I know for a fact wasn't there when...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry.  What are you doing with Dad's Velveeta?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what do you think I'm doing?  I'm gonna eat it.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, Frasier, this isn't funny anymore.  [_Frasier opens the box and pulls a small bottle out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's Viagra!

speaker: Niles
text: They give that away with Velveeta?  [_Frasier gets a dour glare on his face._]

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  It's a prescription for Martin Crane.  Why do you suppose he would put it in here?

speaker: Niles
text: Hiding it, I assume.  What better place than a box Pandora herself would be loathe to open?  [_The sound of the front door can be heard._]

speaker: Frasier
text: It's Dad!  [_He drops the box as Niles throws the pill bottle at him.  They both bend down to grab the items.  Panicking, Frasier puts the cheese box back in the refrigerator.  Too late, Niles notices the pills on the counter and points, making a frantic noise.  With no time, Frasier grabs them and stuffs them in his pocket as Martin walks in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.  What are you doing back so soon?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I forgot something.  My um... brella.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're certainly not going to find it in the kitchen.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I guess not.  [_They all stand there nervously._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I just remembered.  Ronee wanted me to get her an appetizer.  [_He opens the fridge._]

speaker: Martin
text: Let's see, what looks good?  Oh, Velveeta, that goes with anything.  [_He grabs the cheese, closes the fridge and hurries off.  Cut to - the living room as he comes in and the boys follow._]

speaker: Martin
text: All right, well, you boys have got your opera that you want to watch, so I'll just get out of your way.  See you later.  [_He goes out the front door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Now what?

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, we've got time to think.  It's going to take him a while to discover that the pills...  [_The door opens and Martin storms in and tosses the cheese down._]

speaker: Martin
text: All right, where is it?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier took them!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: This is pretty funny to you, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: No, sir.

speaker: Martin
text: Then what is it?  You still so sore about Ronee that you're tryin' to mess things up for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, I found them by accident.  I tried to put them back. I didn't mean to embarrass you.  Here.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, forget it.  I'm just gonna cancel with Ronee.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad...  [_He goes off to the kitchen as Frasier closes the front door._]

speaker: Martin
text: No, the whole night's ruined anyway.  But the important thing is you boys had your little laugh.  Well, I'm glad someone enjoyed it, because I'm startin' to think that it's just too much trouble.  I'm just gonna break it off.  [_He comes back in with a beer and sits in his chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Why would you do that, Dad?  I mean, you're not going to let what happened tonight end things with Ronee, are you?  Is there something else going on here?  [_He comes around the couch as Niles sits on the coffee table._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't know.  Ronee and I have been gettin' kinda close this week and last night we started foolin' around and it was great.  I mean, I was roundin' the bases, the coach was wavin' me in, there wasn't even gonna be a play at the plate...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, it's us.

speaker: Martin
text: Huh?  Oh, right.  Well, anyway, that was when somethin' happened.  Or didn't happen.  Which has never not happened before, so...  [_Frasier sits down beside Niles._]

speaker: Martin
text: I decided today to go out and get some..."cheese."  I just couldn't stop picturing her the way she looked when she was a teenager.  It was creepy.  And even with... "cheese," I don't think I'd ever feel good about being with her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, when she was babysitting for us, did you ever notice her?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  She was a very pretty girl.

speaker: Frasier
text: And did Mom ever notice you notice her?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.  We even had a fight once about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there you are.  You're still feeling guilt and shame for being attracted to her all those years ago.  But she's an adult now and you should really allow yourself to explore these feelings.

speaker: Niles
text: Very good, Frasier.  [_Frasier glowers at the patronizing tone, but goes on._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.  You know, perhaps my depression over losing Ronee was actually rooted in my feelings for her from long ago as well.  After all, she was the first person to reject me.  Even though she never knew it.  Perhaps by pursuing her again, I was hoping to undo that first rejection, thereby erasing all the subsequent rejections in my life and giving myself a much needed shot of self-esteem.  [_He jumps up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you hear that?!  My analytical skills are on fire!

speaker: Niles
text: And your own horn-tooting skills haven't abandoned you either.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, so much for worrying about whether I'm ready to get back into private practice.  The answer is a resounding "Yes"!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well you better be sure because it's a completely different animal...and oh, I just remembered, the zoo is having a fund raiser, I signed you up for two hundred dollars, that's the Safari Level, you know who has malaria? Mrs. ...  [_He stands up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Do you realize your babbling kicks in whenever I talk about my return to private practice?  Perhaps this condition of yours has less to do with baby jitters and more to do with my entering your domain.  My God!  If I get any hotter I'm going to set off the sprinklers!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, get over yourself!  Why shouldn't I be anxious?  Can't I ever have one thing that's just mine?  It's like when I discovered backgammon or fencing or...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles!  Relax, it's okay.  You are an excellent psychiatrist.  I couldn't eclipse you if I tried.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're sure?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Splendid.  And Dad, you should go down and see Ronee.  She must like you an awful lot, considering who she passed up.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know.  I know it sounds crazy, but I keep seeing her in that pony-tail and that parochial school uniform.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ronee didn't go to parochial school.

speaker: Martin
text: She didn't?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  That was our other babysitter, Sally.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting_] Oh, right.  Sally the Slut.  I liked her.

speaker: Martin
text: [_rising_] You mean all this time I've been thinking she was someone else?  See ya.  [_He heads for the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, don't you want your "cheese"?

speaker: Martin
text: Nope.  Thanks, boys, but I'm working without a net.  [_He leaves.  Fade out._]
